key_points: Ramin Honary is an Emacs enthusiast who has been working on a project to write an Emacs Lisp interpreter in Scheme
He wants to create a clone of Emacs that can run any 'init.el' and stick closely to the R7RS standard Scheme definition
The goal is to make the project widely adoptable across different Scheme implementations, including Guile

technical_terms.context: what Ramin uses for his work
technical_terms.name: Programming languages used in industry

technical_terms.definition: To run any 'init.el' without significant changes
technical_terms.name: Init file compatibility

technical_terms.context: The Scheme standard that Ramin wants to follow
technical_terms.definition: R7RS (Recursive Standard for the Scheme Language)
technical_terms.name: Scheme language standard

technical_terms.context: The Scheme implementation that Ramin is using as a reference
technical_terms.name: Scheme implementation

technical_terms.context: The target audience for Ramin's project
technical_terms.definition: A study of what the R7RS language can do
technical_terms.name: Study of Scheme language capabilities
